column4: A. B. (1994). *Minimum Wages and Employment: A Case Study of the Fast-Food Industry in New Jersey and Pennsylvania.* American Economic Review.

column1: This project follows a Difference-in-Differences (DiD) design to estimate the effect of New Jersey’s minimum wage increase on fast-food employment
column2: using Pennsylvania as the control group. The key assumption is **parallel trends**: absent the policy
column3: employment outcomes in NJ and PA would have evolved similarly over time.
